brief_summary.textblock:
This trial will assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema (DME)
      in diabetic patients that undergo a DME screening exam.  The screening exam will consist of
      medical history, Electronic ETDRS visual acuity assessment, SD-OCT and color fundus
      photography

clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying Patients With Unrecognized Treatable Diabetic Macular Edema

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ability to provide written informed consent and comply with study assessments for the
             full duration of the study

          -  Age > 18 years

          -  Patient related considerations

          -  Patients with diabetes mellitus

          -  Disease related considerations

          -  Diabetes mellitus

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Prior admission screening within twelve months.

          -  Inability to sit for evaluation

study_pop.textblock:
Patients identified through medical records or admitted into Franklin Square Hospital with
        a history of diabetes

primary_outcome.description: This trial will assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema (DME) in diabetic patients that undergo a DME screening exam.  The screening exam will consist of medical history, Electronic ETDRS visual acuity assessment, SD-OCT and color fundus photography
primary_outcome.measure: Assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (Patients are only seen once for assessments)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Establish methods for streamlining screening and identification of patients at risk.
Establish methods for referral for treatment of patients identified with vision threatening diabetic retinopathy.
secondary_outcome.measure: Streamlining and identification of patients at risk of diabetic macular edema
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (Patients only seen once for assessments)
